curam.util.resources

Class Locale

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.resources.Locale

  • public final class Locale
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides convenience fields and methods for accessing various locale-sensitive formatting facilities in Java.
    See Also:
    DateTime

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      • defaultDateTimeFormat

        public static final java.lang.String defaultDateTimeFormat
        The default date/time format used by Curam. For all locates using a Gregorian calendar, this is the localized ISO format `yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss`.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • defaultDateFormat

        public static final java.lang.String defaultDateFormat
        The default date format used by Curam. For all locates using a Gregorian calendar, this is the localized ISO format `yyyy-MM-dd`.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • defaultTimeFormat

        public static final java.lang.String defaultTimeFormat
        The default time format used by Curam. For all locates using a Gregorian calendar, this is the format `hh:mm:ss`. For non-Gregorian calendars it is the default Java time format.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getFormattedDate

        public static java.lang.String getFormattedDate(DateTime inDate)
        Format a DateTime using the default date format.
        Parameters:
        inDate - The date input.
        Returns:
        A formatted date/time string based on the format string and relative to the server timezone
        See Also:
        Locale.defaultDateFormat

      • getFormattedDate

        public static java.lang.String getFormattedDate(Date inDate,
                                                java.lang.String format)
        Format a Date using the specified date format. You can use any of the constant formats defined by the Locale class.
        Parameters:
        inDate - The date input
        format - The format to output
        Returns:
        A formatted date/time string based on the format string and relative to the server timezone

      • getFormattedDate

        public static java.lang.String getFormattedDate(DateTime inDate,
                                                java.util.Locale locale)
        Format a DateTime using the default date format and using the locale passed in to determine the locale to format the string in.
        Parameters:
        inDate - The date input.
        locale - The locale used to format the date.
        Returns:
        A formatted date/time string based on the format string and relative to the server timezone
        See Also:
        Locale.defaultDateFormat

      • getFormattedDate

        public static java.lang.String getFormattedDate(DateTime inDate,
                                                java.lang.String format,
                                                java.util.Locale locale)
        Format a DateTime using the format and locale passed in to determine the format and locale of the date to return.
        Parameters:
        inDate - The date input.
        format - The format to output
        locale - The locale used to format the date.
        Returns:
        A formatted date/time string based on the format string and relative to the server timezone

        public static java.lang.String getFormattedDateTime(DateTime inDate)

        Returns:
        A formatted date/time string based on the format string and relative to the server timezone
        See Also:

      • getFormattedDateTime

        public static java.lang.String getFormattedDateTime(DateTime inDate,
                                                    java.util.Locale locale)
        Format a DateTime using the default date/time format and the locale passed in.
        Parameters:
        inDate - The dateTime input.
        locale - The locale to use for formatting.
        Returns:
        A formatted date/time string based on the format string and locale passed in and relative to the server timezone.

      • getFormattedDateTime

        public static java.lang.String getFormattedDateTime(DateTime inDate,
                                                    java.lang.String format)
        Format a DateTime using the specified date format. You can use any of the constant formats defined by the Locale class. The text for the format of the Date will be based on the server default locale.
        Parameters:
        inDate - The date input
        format - The format to output.
        Returns:
        A formatted date/time string based on the format string and relative to the server timezone.

      • getFormattedDateTime

        public static java.lang.String getFormattedDateTime(DateTime inDate,
                                                    java.lang.String format,
                                                    java.util.Locale locale)
        Format a DateTime using the specified date format. You can use any of the constant formats defined by the Locale class. The locale passed in is used to determine the locale to format the string in.
        Parameters:
        inDate - The date input
        format - The format to output.
        locale - The locale used in the formatting of the String.
        Returns:
        A formatted date/time string based on the format string and relative to the server timezone.

      • getFormattedTime

        public static java.lang.String getFormattedTime(DateTime inDate,
                                                java.lang.String format)
        Format a DateTime using the specified date format. You can use any of the constant formats defined by the Locale class. The curam.environment.default.locale is used to determine the locale the string will be formatted in.
        Parameters:
        inDate - The date input
        format - The format to output
        Returns:
        A formatted date/time string based on the format string and relative to the server timezone

      • getFormattedTime

        public static java.lang.String getFormattedTime(DateTime inDate,
                                                java.lang.String format,
                                                java.util.Locale locale)
        Format a DateTime using the specified date format. You can use any of the constant formats defined by the Locale class. The locale passed in is used to determine the locale to format the string in.
        Parameters:
        inDate - The date input
        format - The format to output
        locale - The locale used to format the date.
        Returns:
        A formatted date/time string based on the format string and relative to the server timezone

      • trimToLanguageOnly

        public static java.lang.String trimToLanguageOnly(java.lang.String languageString)
        Trims a five character locale code down to its two character language component by removing the country component.
        Parameters:
        languageString - The locale code to trim
        Returns:
        The language component of the given locale code, or the original code if it was null or shorter than two characters.

      • isSupportedLocale

        public static boolean isSupportedLocale(java.lang.String locale)
        This method takes in a string that represents a locale and returns true if this is a valid and supported locale. The locale is valid if it is contained within the list returned by the java Locale.getAvailableLocales() method.
        Parameters:
        locale - The string representing a locale.
        Returns:
        A boolean value set to true if the locale passed in is a valid locale.

      • isValidLocale

        public static boolean isValidLocale(java.lang.String locale)
        This method takes in a string that represents a locale and returns true if this locale contains a valid language and country specifications. The list of supported languages is returned by Locale.getISOLanguages() method, and the list of supported countries is returned by Locale.getISOCountries() method. Valid locale components do not indicate that the locale is supported by the JDK.
        Parameters:
        locale - The string representing a locale.
        Returns:
        A boolean value set to true if the locale contains valid language and country components.

      • resetLocaleCache

        public static void resetLocaleCache()
        This method is for testing purposes ONLY and must NEVER be called outside a Unit Test environment. This method resets a local cache to enable the switching between time zones in a Unit Test environment when calling methods in this Locale class.
